Instrument.name: The Optical, Spectroscopic, and Infrared Remote Imaging System (OSIRIS) Narrow Angle Camera (NAC) for the Rosetta Orbiter
Instrument.description: The Optical, Spectroscopic, and Infrared Remote Imaging System (OSIRIS) was the primary imaging system on the Rosetta spacecraft. The Narrow Angle Camera (NAC) was constructed with an off-axis three mirror system to direct the light beam, a double filter wheel, a mechanical shutter, an anti-radiation plate, and a CCD detector. The double filter wheel enabled the use of a refocusing plate in conjunction with a filter to allow optimum focus at 4km and 1.2km distance from the comet. Filters available in the NAC ranged in coverage from 269.3 nm to 989.3 nm. The field of view was 2.20 x 2.22 degrees.
